Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of time that the Senate has failed to pass a budget, stating it as 750 days when it is actually less than that.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any specific evidence or data to support the assertion that Senate Democrats have neglected their basic responsibilities.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that passing a budget is the most basic responsibility of the Senate without providing any justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider any alternative explanations for why the Senate has not passed a budget, such as potential obstacles or disagreements among lawmakers.
